title: Millbrook 2016 Castle Hill Vineyard Estate Bottled Riesling (Hudson River Region)
description: Vibrant on the nose in vivid notes of red apple, peach blossom and slate, the palate carries similar tones along a lime-zest river of acidity. There's nice weight and feel to this wine, with a good concentration of flavors and a delicate astringency to the citrus blossom finish.

title: Pascal Aufranc 2016 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas)
description: Named after the cherry trees (cerisiers) that surround the vineyard, this wine is richly flavored, yes, with cherries as well as crisper red currants. It is spicy, with a touch of pepper as well as some firm tannins. Drink this fruity, young wine from late 2018.

title: Robert Perroud 2015 La Fournaise du Pérou  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: Grown on volcanic soil on the slopes of Mont Brouilly, this wine has a strong mineral character as well as rich black fruits. It is a concentrated wine with a dry core and balanced acidity. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Robert Perroud 2016 Pollen  (Brouilly)
description: From a selection of the estate's best fruit, this wine is richly structured, firmly textured and likely to age well in the medium term. The black fruits are still young, giving a brightness to the wine that perhaps should be allowed to calm down. Drink this ripe wine from late 2018.

title: Roccheviberti 2013 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)
description: New leather, tobacco and underbrush aromas emerge along with a balsamic whiff of camphor. Firmly structured, the youthfully austere palate evokes tart cherry, red raspberry, star anise and chopped herb framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Santa Carolina 2015 Dolmen Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)
description: A full-fruit nose with grapy aromas of boysenberry and not much oak character gets this low-alcohol (12.5%) Cabernet off to an unconventional start. Jamminess is maintained on the palate, which feels plump but shy on tannic structure. Easygoing berry-compote flavors settle on blueberry on a soft finish. Only 450 cases were made. Drink through 2020.

title: Santa Rita 2013 Pehuén Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
description: A dense nose with prune, mint and green-herb aromas is soft, round and loses spunk as it breathes. A wide chunky palate is full but inexact, while this tastes oaky and savory, with spice, berry and tobacco flavors. Heat and chewy tannins propel the finish on this Apalta Carmenère. Drink through 2020.

title: Spier 2015 Vintage Selection Pinotage (Coastal Region)
description: There's currently an upfront oaky presence to this wine, with bold notes of toasted vanilla, char and sweet spice that sit atop a brambly, ripe dark-fruit core. Flavors of cherry pie, baked plum and boysenberry abound on the medium-weight palate, framed by structured tannins that result in a texture like crushed velvet. Notes of pepper, game and leather unfold on the evolving finish. Drink now–2022.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Apetlon Rouge Red (Burgenland)
description: The nose brims with fruit. Fleshy, almost overripe red cherry sets the tone on the nose that carries through to the palate. The body is juicy but has some grip while the cherry fruit attains crunch, a touch of white pepper spice and more freshness than the nose would suggest. The finish is vivid and moreish.

title: Tangley Oaks 2015 Lot 12 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Sophisticated and full bodied, this generous style of wine wraps complex and subtle oak spices around a warm, generous core of ripe pear and apple notes. Wonderful vanilla bean and nutmeg nuances linger in the creamy texture and echo on the finish.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very chalky aromas of lime skins, lemon rinds and a touch of Gala apple flesh makes for an inviting nose to this estate bottling. The palate picks up the region's telltale sea salt flavors, which give savory depth to the seared lemon rind flavors. The acidity and texture are both firm.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 8% Petite Sirah, this is a velvety herbaceous wine with earthy undertones that presents as both rustic and refined. Leathery black pepper meets mushroom and cedar as the medium-ripe flavors lead to a juicy finish.

title: Dolin 2014 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There's a strong hazelnut character on this bottling from an iconic vineyard, with touches of lemon-laced crème brûlée and pink grapefruit zest. The nutty quality translates to pecans on the sip, with orange marmalade, toasted croissant and a slight bit of marshmallow toward the finish.

title: Domaine des Chers 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)
description: From the northernmost Beaujolais cru, this wine is bold, ripe and fruity. Its tannins and acidity promise good aging and the chance to enhance the fragrant red-cherry fruitiness. This wine will be ready from late 2018.

title: Chalk Hill 2014 Chairman's Club Carmenère (Chalk Hill)
description: An uncommon find in the appellation, this red is blended with 6% Cabernet Sauvignon and given nearly two years in 60% new French oak. Dusty, it's bold and rustic, with shocks of currant, blackberry and broadly distributed oak, the lasting note a mix of clove and black pepper.

title: Barons 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: All coming from Hedges Estate Vineyard and aged in 100% new French oak, this wine has had a full five years to develop and it's made the best of it. Aromas of spice box, dark fruit, vanilla and high-toned herb are followed by luscious black-fruit flavors that stretch out on the finish. It's unabashed in its appeal with a lot of life in front of it.

title: Barons 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: The fruit for this wine all comes from Hedges Estate Vineyard. Brooding aromas of soil, dark fruit, cigar, herb and spice box lead to palate-coating dark-fruit flavors—well balanced fruit flavors. Firm, lightly chalky tannins provide support. Give it some time in the cellar to develop. Best after 2020.

title: Boudreaux Cellars 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)
description: The aromas bring notes of cigar box, mortared herbs and cherry. The palate is tart, fresh and acid driven, with well-balanced fruit flavors that stretch out on the finish. It should still have a good life in front of it.

title: Brutocao 2013 Contento Vineyard Estate Bottled Primitivo (Mendocino)
description: An aroma like white pepper and damp earth leads to brawny fruit flavors in this full-bodied, concentrated and complex wine made from a grape variety genetically identical to Zinfandel, but often with slightly different flavors. It has a good firm texture, attractive balance for a wine of its size, and a lingering finish.

title: Castello di Fonterutoli 2015  Chianti Classico
description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, Malvasia Nera and Colorino, this opens with aromas of toast, oak, underbrush and espresso. The concentrated, medium-bodied is dense yet linear, delivering ripe black cherry, crushed blackberry, licorice and coffee bean. Assertive, close-grained tannins grip the finish.

title: Giesen 2014 Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point The Fuder Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: More subtle in style compared to Giesen's other single-vineyard offering, Matthews Lane, this wine offers stone fruit, lemon tea, snow pea and wild mint aromas. The opulent palate boasts tongue-tingling acidity and a citrus zing amidst a round texture.
designation: Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point The Fuder

title: Giesen 2014 Single Vineyard Selection Matthews Lane The Fuder Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Over one million cuttings from the Matthews Lane Vineyard have been supplied to nurseries—and therefore wineries—around Marlborough, so in theory, there's a small piece of it in many of the wines from the region. It's special, then, to taste Giesen's single-vineyard version, aged in 1000 liter German fuders. Trademark regional characters of jalepeño, green beans and grass marry with lemon balm, pressed yellow flowers and butter, all ensconced in an oily texture, slippery acidity and a grassy finish.
designation: Single Vineyard Selection Matthews Lane The Fuder

title: Château Thivin 2016  Côte de Brouilly
description: This estate is the most famous and influential in Côte de Brouilly. This wine, from 50-year-old vines, is rich and structured while also having delicious ripe berry and black-cherry fruits. It is likely to age well over the next few months, being ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Estate Vineyard Proprietary Red (Central Coast)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows deep blackberry and black currant aromas alongside baked goods and a touch of violets. There is impressive density to the palate, where black plum flavors blend with lavender and baking spice on the finish. The tannins are still quite firm.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: This wine displays the typical mineral texture associated with this vineyard of granite and schist soils. The texture is given further strength by tannins that suggest the wine needs to age. There is plenty of black fruit as well, so this wine will be best from 2019.

title: David Frost 2015 Par Excellence Cape Blend Red (Western Cape)
description: This Pinotage-based blend, with 15% Shiraz and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, is dark and brooding in the glass. Initial aromas of rich, ripe black berries and cherry sets the stage for the bold, concentrated palate, with notes of char, espresso, licorice root and earthy spice throughout. Medium-plus in weight, with robust and gripping tannins, this firmly structured pour shows great power and length. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Ampelos 2014 Gamma Ampelos Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Burly red fruit meets charred oak and a soft supple texture in this medium-bodied wine that's made entirely from estate-grown grapes. A pretty undertone of violet provides floral flourish as white pepper teases on the lengthy, earthy finish.

title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Substantial fruit flavors and good structure highlight this medium- to full-bodied, concentrated wine. It has a straightforward, no-nonsense approach and offers great value. Enticing black cherry and raspberry flavors are supported by fine-grained tannins and crisp acidity. The fruit notes are pure, clean and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This is a traditional dry, full-bodied and well-balanced Zin that's made to go with a hearty meal. Ripe but not sweet boysenberry flavors are shaded with mineral, wood smoke and light baking spice accents, while firm tannins lend grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Castello d'Albola 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Truffle, tilled earth, exotic spice and woodland berry aromas emerge in the glass along with a toasted note. It's racy and firmly structured, offering tart red cherry, cranberry, coffee bean and clove set against tightly drawn, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
